text: In Python - a way to choose which dictionary to iterate over (and manipulate values in)
Lets say I have two dictionaries, dict_a and dict_b.
Each of them have similar keys and values that I can manipulate in the same way, and in fact that's what I'm doing in a large piece of code.
Only I don't want to have to write it twice.
However, I can't do something like this:

code:
if choose_a == 1:
    for x and y in dict_a.iteritems():
    # goto line 20

if choose_b == 1:
    for x and y in dict_b.iteritems():
    # goto line 20

 # line 20
 # do stuff with x and y.

text: Except I have no idea what to do in a situation like this.
If there is a like thread, please point me to it, and forgive me if I have violated anything (first post).
Thanks in advance, I appreciate any help.
